message: I was adding some functionalities for appbuilder to my kynetx Dev Suite app based on SuiteFramework when I decided to have another look at the ace editor
and plug the KNS REST api in it
appbuilder is based on it : http://ace.ajax.org/ ( used to be mozilla project called bespin then skywriter)
to see if there was a cleaner way to enhance the editor and there is a way
https://github.com/ajaxorg/ace/blob/master/lib/ace/commands/default_commands.js
it's called "commands"
( the github repository doesn't seem to be the one that is in production by the way)
What makes more sense imho for the future is to fork  cloud9 IDE https://github.com/ajaxorg/cloud9
ok I just had a deeper look inside it
for example this : http://apps.kynetx.com/javascripts/editor.js
so the kynetx appbuilder https://github.com/kynetx/AppBuilder seems to be a kind of hybrid
( I love dts, discover, think and share)
there is also some http://codemirror.net/ code inside the kynetx appbuilder
So I am a little bit confused about where to extend it
try it freely here: http://cloud9ide.com
cloud9 IDE is a nodejs app
so you can deploy it freely here : http://www.duostack.com/
or get a beta invite for http://www.dotcloud.com/
codemirror was the old editor we used, now we only use ace.
any remaining codemirror code will eventually be cleaned out.
